title: LAKE WYLIE (CATAWBA RESERVOIR), SOUTH POINT
snippet: South Point Launch on Lake Wylie provides access to the northeast arm of the lake, making it a popular spot for paddling and water recreation

title: LAKE WYLIE (CATAWBA RESERVOIR)
snippet: The dam was rebuilt in 1924 and the lake's surface expanded to approximately 13,443 acres and 325 miles of shoreline

title: MOUNTAIN ISLAND RESERVOIR, RIVERBEND
snippet: Mountain Island Lake was built in 1924 with the construction of Mountain Island Hydroelectric Station.

title: MOUNTAIN ISLAND RESERVOIR, NECK ROAD
snippet: Mountain Island Lake was built in 1924 with the construction of Mountain Island Hydroelectric Station.

title: MOUNTAIN ISLAND RESERVOIR, LUCIA

title: MOUNTAIN ISLAND RESERVOIR, HIGHWAY 73

title: LAKE NORMAN, BEATTIES FORD
snippet: Beatty’s Ford Access Area and boat ramp are adjacent to Beatty’s Ford Park. Located on the West shore of the lake in Denver, Beatty’s Ford Access Area has ample room for parking and multiple ramps for quick access.

title: LAKE NORMAN, LITTLE CREEK
snippet: Little Creek Access Area is another public access boat ramp located on the West shore of the lake in Denver, NC. This access area is North of Beatty’s Ford Access Area, and more convenient to Mooresville and Sherrill’s Ford.

title: LAKE NORMAN, HAGER CREEK
snippet: Hager Creek Access Area is open to the public and provides ample room for launching large boats. Parking is also plentiful here.

title: LAKE NORMAN, PINNACLE
snippet: This public access boat ramp facility has a roomy parking lot that can accommodate nearly any size rig. A total of five boat ramps here ensures you won’t have to wait long to launch.

title: LAKE NORMAN, MCCRARY CREEK
snippet: Another Mooresville public boat ramp, McCrary Creek Access Area is located just off Highway 150. The area is adjacent to Queens Landing and offers access to nearby amenities like restaurants and restrooms.

title: LAKE NORMAN, LONG ISLAND
snippet: The farthest upriver public access area.  On main channel.

title: LOOKOUT SHOALS RESERVOIR
snippet: Lookout Shoals Lake is a 1,270-acre reservoir on the Catawba River, near Statesville, North Carolina

title: LOOKOUT SHOALS RESERVOIR, SHARON
snippet: Lookout Shoals Lake is a lakefront living gem in North Carolina’s Piedmont region

title: LAKE HICKORY, OXFORD
snippet: Lookout Shoals Lake is a lakefront living gem in North Carolina’s Piedmont region

title: LAKE HICKORY, DUSTY RIDGE
snippet: This paddling trip sets off from the Dusty Ridge access located in the northeastern part of the lake.

title: LAKE HICKORY, WITTENBURG
snippet: The destination centers around a sandy beachfront overlooking Lake Hickory and includes a swim beach, outdoor showers, a changing area, restrooms, concessions, a park office, picnic shelters, a fishing pier, boat access, nature trail and more

title: LAKE HICKORY, LOVELADY
snippet: It is a popular access point for boating on Lake Hickory. The area is known for its fishing opportunities and access to the Abbott's Creek section of the lake

title: LAKE HICKORY, GUNPOWDER
snippet: Gunpowder Creek begins in the mountains of the piedmont and flows through the town of Granite Falls and into Lake Hickory.

title: LAKE RHODHISS, RHODHISS
snippet: Lake Rhodhiss is a pristine lake located at the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains in Western North Carolina.

title: LAKE RHODHISS, CONLEY CREEK
snippet: Lake Rhodhiss is a pristine lake located at the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains in Western North Carolina.

title: LAKE RHODHISS, CASTLE BRIDGE
snippet: Lake Rhodhiss is a pristine lake located at the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains in Western North Carolina.

title: JOHNS RIVER
snippet: With 5 miles of frontage on the Johns River, there are plenty of places to enjoy a lazy summer afternoon or one of our warm winter days.
